title: Cup And Saucer, "Leningrad 1935", 1935
markings: On underside of cup: Lomonosov mark for 1937 stamped in orange overglaze; (in Russian:) 'V. Freze / "Leningrad 1935"' hand-painted in black overglaze. On underside of saucer: Lomonosov mark for 1937 stamped in orange overglaze.
provenance: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; 1989: acquired by Museum
dimensions:
H x diam. (a, b): 7.8 x 13.3 cm (3 1/16 x 5 1/4 in.)
H x W x D (a: cup): 6.7 x 8.9 x 7.3 cm (2 5/8 x 3 1/2 x 2 7/8 in.)
H x diam. (b: saucer): 1.9 x 13.3 cm (3/4 x 5 1/4 in.)
creditline: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds
description: Cylindrical cup, rounded at base, loop handle; painted on front in polychrome enamels with picture of the Peter and Paul Fortress and Kirovsky (Troitsky) Bridge over Neva River, back has gilded image of Egyptian sphinx from Embankment at University Wharf. Saucer has gilded ribbon border around outer edge.

tombstone.epitaph:
Cup And Saucer, "Leningrad 1935", 1935.
1935. Enameled, gilt and glazed porcelain. The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds. 1989-41-91-a,b.
